content: A mutual exclusion primitive — a lock that serializes access to shared RAM regions across core boundaries. Spinlocks, semaphores, and read-write locks are common variants. Contention on hot mutexes is a top scalability bottleneck. Language runtimes sometimes enforce broader exclusion: Python's GIL or JavaScript's event loop sidestep data races by constraining concurrency at the language level. core :: contenido tention on hot mutexes is a top scalability bottleneck.
